DataElement.preferredName: Graft Versus Host Disease Preventive Intervention Planned Occurrence And/Or Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not graft versus host disease prophylaxis was planned or administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Graft Versus Host Disease Preventive Intervention Planned Occurrence And/Or Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An incompatibility reaction (which may be fatal) in a subject (host) of low immunological competence (deficient lymphoid tissue) who has been the recipient of immunologically competent lymphoid tissue from a donor who lacks at least one antigen possessed by the recipient host; the reaction, or disease, is the result of action of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that possess the antigen not possessed by the donor. Seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation, acute disease is seen after 5-40 days and chronic disease weeks to months after transplantation, affecting, principally, the gastrointestinal tract, liver, and skin._Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease._An instance of an event or incident that is intended to take place._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Graft Versus Host Disease Preventive Intervention
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An incompatibility reaction (which may be fatal) in a subject (host) of low immunological competence (deficient lymphoid tissue) who has been the recipient of immunologically competent lymphoid tissue from a donor who lacks at least one antigen possessed by the recipient host; the reaction, or disease, is the result of action of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that possess the antigen not possessed by the donor. Seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation, acute disease is seen after 5-40 days and chronic disease weeks to months after transplantation, affecting, principally, the gastrointestinal tract, liver, and skin.:An attempt to prevent disease.

Concepts.definition: A reaction, which may be fatal, in an immunocompromised subject (host) who has received an antigenically incompatible tissue transplant (graft) from an immunocompetent donor. The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: An instance of an event or incident that is intended to take place.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: An instance of an event or incident that is intended to take place.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
